description: For three quarters, the Tampa Bay Buccaneers were abysmal on offense but Tom Brady showed up in the fourth quarter and turned the game around.

description: Need another reason Tampa Bay Buccaneers' Tom Brady is the greatest of all-time? Look no further than his game-winning drive against the Saints on Monday night

title: Kirstie Alley through the years
description: Kirstie Alley died at the age of 71 following a battle with cancer. Here is a look back at her life and career in entertainment.

title: TUCKER CARLSON: This isn't how our system is supposed to work
description: Tucker Carlson delves into the relationship between the FBI and Twitter on 'Tucker Carlson Tonight.'

title: Tom Brady screams at Bucs teammates as offense sputters vs Saints
description: Tom Brady was seen screaming at his teammates on the sideline after the Tampa Bay Buccaneers punted to start the fourth quarter against the New Orleans Saints.

title: SEAN HANNITY: The media were complicit in 'outright censorship'
description: Sean Hannity discusses the corruption from Twitter and the FBI illuminated by Elon Musk on "Hannity."

title: North Korea executes teenagers for distributing South Korean TV, movies: report
description: Korean media, citing witnesses, reports that North Korean authorities executed two teens for the crime of watching and distributing South Korean movies.

title: Tiger Woods reveals his son, Charlie, 13, is already outdriving him
description: Tiger Woods will admit it: his 13-year-old son, Charlie, has already outdrove him as the elder has told him to emulate Rory McIlroy's swing.

title: John Travolta, Jamie Lee Curtis and other Hollywood stars reacts to the death of Kirstie Alley
description: Kirstie Alley died after an "unexpected" battle with cancer. Hollywood stars, including John Travolta, are honoring the actress following her death.

title: NHL star Carey Price's opposition to Canadian gun bill creates stir
description: Montreal Canadiens goaltender Carey Price tweeted his opposition to a Canadian gun-control bill over the weekend, and it caused a stir in the country.

title: Dallas police arrest Texas man for two murders in 36-hour period
description: Dallas, Texas police and U.S. Marshals arrested Diavian Roberts for allegedly shooting and killing two people within a 36-hour period in the Dallas area.

title: Texas Rep. Dan Crenshaw proposes $6,500 bonus for Border Patrol Agents
description: Representative Dan Crenshaw introduced legislation proposing a $6,500 “deployment bonus” for agents serving along high trafficked areas of the U.S. border.

title: Oklahoma quadruple homicide: Suspect charged in execution-style murders at marijuana farm
description: A 45-year-old man was charged with four counts of first-degree murder after allegedly shooting and killing four workers at a marijuana farm in Oklahoma last month.

title: Biden chief of staff says president will decide on 2024 over holidays, expects him to run
description: White House chief of staff Ronald Klain said during the Wall Street Journal’s CEO Council Summit that President Biden will decide over the holidays whether to run again.

title: Rob Gronkowski fulfills goal on football field in retirement
description: Former Tampa Bay Buccaneers tight end Rob Gronkowski fulfilled the goal of kicking a field goal over the weekend, even if it came in his retirement.

title: JESSE WATTERS: Dems and Hollywood turned the Kennedy Center Honors into the new Oscars
description: Fox News host Jesse Watters blasts Democrats and Hollywood for awarding themselves while the rest of America struggles on 'Jesse Watters Primetime.'

title: Clayton Kershaw re-signs with Dodgers for 2023 season
description: Los Angeles Dodgers pitcher Clayton Kershaw will be back with the team in 2023 after an All-Star season at age 34. He signed a one-year deal.

title: Canceled figures Rittenhouse, Sandmann see opportunity in Musk's 'Twitter files' dump
description: Rittenhouse and Sandmann asked Elon Musk to release company communications pertaining to their online treatment following the release of the 'Twitter Files.'

title: Kirstie Alley dead at 71
description: Kirstie Alley died on Monday following a battle with cancer that was only "recently discovered," according to her family. She was 71.

title: ABC News avoids Amy Robach, TJ Holmes being benched from 'GMA' as extramarital affair makes headlines
description: ABC News made no mention of the steamy love affair between "GMA3" co-hosts Amy Robach and TJ Holmes in any of its coverage as the two anchors were sidelined by the network.

title: British animal rights activists protest at London steakhouse owned by 'Salt Bae'
description: Animal rights activists tried to protest at the London steakhouse Nusr-Et, but were removed by staff at the upscale restaurant on Saturday evening.

title: Heisman Trophy finalists announced as Caleb Williams leads the pack
description: USC's Caleb Williams leads the Heisman Trophy finalists that were announced on Monday. Georgia's Stetson Bennett, TCU's Max Duggan and Ohio State's C.J. Stroud round out the bunch.

title: Aaron Judge shows up to Bucs game as he reportedly garners massive offers on free-agent market
description: Aaron Judge showed up to support the Tampa Bay Buccaneers and wide receiver Mike Evans on Monday night as they took on the New Orleans Saints.

title: Olivia Wilde returns to Instagram with a bikini picture following Harry Styles split
description: Olivia Wilde returned to Instagram on Sunday after a brief hiatus following her reported split from Harry Styles in November. The actress was in a bikini with her friend in the post.

title: Outrage at Musk-Taibbi 'Twitter Files' dump revealed media are the true 'bots,' some critics say
description: Elon Musk and former Rolling Stone journalist Matt Taibbi were criticized for releasing the 'Twitter Files' on Friday and into the weekend; the panel on 'The Five' responded.

title: Gladys Knight on her decades-long friendship with Patti LaBelle: 'That's my little sister'
description: Gladys Knight told Fox News Digital she looks at Patti LaBelle as a younger sister as the two have managed to remain friends for six decades.

title: North Carolina busts two illegal migrants with 40 pounds of drugs: police
description: North Carolina police busted two illegal immigrants for drug trafficking on Nov. 29, after they were found with 40 pounds of high-grade marijuana.

title: The Grinch could be stealing your Christmas checks
description: The Postal Service has seen a rash of "mailbox fishing," the practice of thieves filching letters out of mailboxes, finding checks and then altering and cashing them.

title: USC's Caleb Williams clarifies deleted tweet about TCU quarterback: 'Wasn’t laughing at Max D!'
description: USC quarterback Caleb Williams said on Twitter Sunday that he wasn't "laughing" at TCU quarterback Max Duggan in response to a video of the distraught signal caller.

title: Ex-EcoHealth Alliance VP pens book on how COVID came from lab leak: 'All of this could have been avoided'
description: Fox News Digital spoke with Dr. Andrew G. Huff, the author of his new book "The truth About Wuhan: How I Uncovered the Biggest Lie in History" about the origins of COVID.

title: Yankees announce Brian Cashman's return as GM with multi-year extension
description: The New York Yankees are extending GM Brian Cashman for the next four seasons as they hope continuity results in another World Series title.

title: Naomi Judd's family files notice to dismiss lawsuit over the country star's death records
description: Naomi Judd's family filed a notice to dismiss the lawsuit they originally filed to keep the late country music icon's death records sealed. Naomi Judd died in April at the age of 76.

title: Washington Post writers slammed for defense of Hunter Biden laptop coverage: ‘Fake new rules’
description: Washington Post's Philip Bump and Glenn Kessler defended their outlet’s limited reporting on the Hunter Biden laptop story back in 2020, claiming they didn't have the data.

title: Mayorkas defends DHS record amid record illegal border crossings
description: Department of Homeland Security Secretary Alejandro Mayorkas defended efforts along the southern border on Monday, despite record number of illegal crossings.

title: Samaritan's Purse crosses threshold of 100M pounds of food distributed in war-torn Ukraine
description: Samaritan's Purse, the international Christian relief and evangelism organization run by Rev. Franklin Graham, has now distributed more than 100 million pounds of food in war-torn Ukraine.

title: France's Kylian Mbappe deliberately hiding Budweiser logo in 'Man of the Match' photos: report
description: France superstar Kylian Mbappe has been hiding the Budweiser logo during his "Man of the Match" award photos, and reports say it's being done on purpose at the World Cup.
